text:
64
Appendix 6
CONSULTATION SERVICES
(Note: In some cases these visits were to new stations which were having
difficulties in which they needed assistance. In other cases they
were visits to locations where no station was assured. The success
of these teams — and later individual visits — in helping to secure
support, approval, and station activation is a tribute to the quality
of the NAEB individuals who made themselves available as consul¬
tants .)
Station WTVS, Detroit. June 8 - 10, 1955, Consultants: John Schwarzwalder,
(then) KUHT, University of Houston; William Harley, WHA-TV, University of
Wisconsin; Rudolph Bretz, Alabama ETV Commission; John Winnie, State Uni¬
versity of Iowa; E. A, Hungerford, Jr,, Metropolitan ETV Association, New
York; Cecil Bidlack, NAEB.
Station KUON-TV, University of Nebraska. December 5 - 7, 1955. Consul¬
tants: Armand Hunter, WKAR-TV, Michigan State University; John Winnie,
State University of Iowa; Jack Chenoweth, KETC, St. Louis; Cecil Bidlack,
NAEB.
WOSU-TV, Ohio State University. March 12 - 14, 1956. Consultants:
Armand Hunter, WKAR-TV, Michigan State University; Jack Chenoweth, KETC,
St. Louis; Edward Stasheff, University of Michigan; Cecil Bidlack, NAEB.
WKNO-TV, Memphis. March 24 - 31, 1956. Consultant: William Wood,
WTVS, Detroit.
WKNO-TV, Memphis. May 24 - 25, 1956. Consultant: Jack Chenoweth,
KETC, St. Louis.
Oregon State System of Higher Education. June 18 - 23, 1956. Consultant:
Armand Hunter, WKAR-TV, Michigan State University.
University of Alabama, Tuscaloosa, Alabama, April 17 - 20, 1957. Consultant:
Frederick Remley, Jr., University of Michigan.
Metropolitan Educational Television Association, New York, April 22 - 24, 1957.
Consultants: John W, Taylor, WTTW, Chicago; George Arms, KETC, St. Louis;
John White, KQED, Pittsburgh.
KETC, St. Louis, June 15 - 18, 1957. Consultant: Richard B. Hull, WOSU-TV,
Ohio State University.
KUED, Salt Lake City, Utah, August 25 - 27, 1958. Consultant: James Day,
KQED, San Francisco.
